snippet.description: You have only a few minutes to make a great impression on the parents of your students. Watch how an experienced high school teacher fills those oh-so-quick 10 minutes during the annual Back to School Night program. Grab the free Prezi slide template here: http://bit.ly/1QLeSeM
snippet.title: Back To School Night: A Little Like Speed Dating

snippet.description:
This one goes out to all the teachers, bus drivers, administrators, and support staff who teach and love our children. THANK YOU for all you do! New videos every Tuesday and Friday! Subscribe? Maybe *******SUBSCRIBE: http://bit.ly/SUBHoldernessFam
*******https://www.facebook.com/TheHoldernessfamily
********www.TheHoldernessFamily.com
@pennholderness
@kimdholderness
oh, and @snootyneighbor (yep she just started tweeting) The Holderness family has been dancing in pajamas and singing during snow days for years — but last year they hit the record button on the camera and published their goofy video on YouTube. Their video, “Xmas Jammies", has been viewed almost 15 million times.

Penn, Kim, Lola, and Penn Charles continue to make hilarious videos around tent-pole events and circumstances most families face.

Penn, the Dad, took a chance and left his job as a news anchor to join his wife Kim, the Mom, at their video production and digital marketing company, Greenroom Communications, LLC. Lola (7) and Penn Charles (4) are always happy, respectful and eat all of their vegetables (that last part is a lie). . 

About the Holderness Family 
The Holderness Family creates original music, parodies, and Vlogs for YouTube to poke fun of themselves and celebrate the absurdity in circumstances most families face in their day to day life. They published "Christmas Jammies" in December 2013 and life hasn't been the same. Since then, their popular parodies, "All About That Baste", "Baby Got Class," and original music "Snow Day" have received national news coverage. Penn, the Dad, took a chance and left his job as a news anchor to join his wife Kim, the Mom, at their video production and digital marketing company, Greenroom Communications, LLC. Lola and Penn Charles are always happy, respectful and eat all of their vegetables (that last sentence is a lie). Penn, Kim, Lola, and Penn Charles publish music videos, Vlogs and special YouTube challenges to this channel every Tuesday and Friday. Our viewers have become our family and we try our best to respond to comments, suggestions and special requests! Subscribe to be part of this crazy family! SUBSCRIBE!
snippet.title: Baby Got Class -- A back to school parody | The Holderness Family

snippet.description: I meant to upload this back in May, but I never got around to it! Here's a few ideas on how to set up your classroom for Open House or Back to School Night! As you can see, I'm lucky enough to have iPads, plus I already have some student work from my first year of teaching. If your master teacher has any old student work that he or she saved, you can ask them if they'd be willing to share it with you. Parents love seeing student examples!
snippet.title: SOST #10 (Scares of Student Teaching) - Open House/Back to School Night Classroom Ideas

snippet.description: This is a video I created for the parents of my students. It is an overview of class/school rules, class expectations and procedures.

snippet.description:
Here are my Top 10 tips for Meet the Teacher and/or Parent Night! These can be two of the most stressful nights of the school year! Hopefully these tips can help build confidence and start off the Back to School season strong!
Make sure to leave a comment below including some of your favorite tips for Parent Night or Meet the Teacher!

1. Parent Checklist
2. Create Number Charts
3. Give Parents Something to do
4. Organize Paperwork in a Folder
5. Have Baskets or Trays out
6. Have a Giving Tree
7. Have a Sign in Sheet
8. Have Games or Toys for Siblings
9. Parent Goodies
10. Have a Code Word!

IKEA Frames - http://www.ikea.com/us/en/catalog/products/30151035/

snippet.description:
Mrs. James is a 7th grade Literature Teacher at Columbus City Preparatory School for Girls.  She is known for her creativity, challenging curriculum and fun-loving personality.  Since Mrs. James has the same students for 7th grade that she had for 6th grade last year, she and the girls didn't want to be redundant by saying the same thing at Open House that was said last year--or give information that every parent already knew--so they decided to create a video showcasing the class.  

Hey Parents! Ever wonder what REALLY goes on in the classroom when you're not there? Check this out!
snippet.title: Mrs. James' Class ... Parent Open House Video GONE WRONG!

snippet.description: Remind team member and former teacher +Clara Galan will be interviewing +Gwen Pescatore , Parent-Teacher Chat (  #PTChat   ) moderator, President of Knapp Elementary, and mom to three, +Sylvia Lima , Communications chair for the Community Parent Network and Social Emotional Learning committees parent representative at her local elementary and high school, and Daisy Marino, fourth grade teacher, blogger, mother and Remind Teacher Advisory Board member on Thursday, 9/18 at 5:00PM PST. They'll be discussing strategies to get parents involved throughout the school year and build partnerships to support students' academic and social skills.
snippet.title: Parent-Teacher Partnerships: Building the Relationship beyond Back-to-School Night

snippet.description: NWJH Back to School Night 2016: September 1st from 6:15-8:30pm.  FREE Spaghetti & Pizza dinner for all NWJH students and their families.  After dinner, families have the opportunity to meet all their student's teachers.  Free babysitting provided by NWJH Student Council.
snippet.title: Back To School Night Promotional Video
